document.docAuthor: Reshchikov, Alexey, Santos, Bernardo F., Liu, Jing-Xian & Barthélémy, Christophe
document.docTitle: Palpostilpnus tamasek Reshchikov & Santos & Liu & Barthélémy 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of Palpostilpnus Aubert (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Phygadeuontinae), with the description of ten new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of Palpostilpnus Aubert (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Phygadeuontinae), with the description of ten new species

figureCitation.captionText-0: Fig. 17. Palpostilpnus tamasek sp. nov., holotype, ♀ (LKCNHM). A. Lateral habitus. B. Head, anterior view. C. Mesopleuron. D. T1, lateral view. E. Scutum.
figureCitation.captionText-1: Fig. 18. Palpostilpnus tamasek sp. nov., holotype, ♀ (LKCNHM). A. Metasoma, dorsal view. B. Propodeum, dorsal view. C. Ovipositor. D. Wings.
figureCitation.captionText-2: Fig. 19. Palpostilpnus tamasek sp. nov., paratype, ♂ (LKCNHM). A. Lateral habitus. B. Head, anterior view. C. Mesopleuron. D. Propodeum. E. Hypopygium, ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: The specific name is derived from the type locality, Tamasek, an early recorded name of a settlement on the site of modern Singapore .

INDONESIA • 1 ♀ ; Seram , Solea village ;
Aug. 1987
; M.C. Day leg.; Malaise trap ; NHMUK BMNH(E) 1987-262
•
1 ♀ ; W Java , Gurung Haliman National Park ;
21 Jan.–15 Feb. 2000
; G. Broad leg.; canopy; NHMUK BMNH(E) 2006-170
.

MALAYSIA • 1 ♀ ; Sarawak ; May–
Jun. 1978
; N.M. Collins leg.; 4 th Division Garrison Milu , RGS Expedition ; NHMUK
.
SIZE. Fore wing length 3mm . Body oblique elongate, 1.72 times as long as high ( Fig. 17A ).

COLOUR. Body mostly ferruginous (but variable, see below). Flagellomeres starting from 2 dorsally, head (excluding basal parts of mandibles), pronotum, mesoscutum (except yellow anterior lateral edges), central part of scutellum, anterior part of mesopleuron, apical part of hind tibia, hind part of T1 and central part of T2–T5 black. Anterior lateral edge of mesoscutum, anterior upper angle of mesopleuron, and fore and middle trochanters pale yellow. Palpi white. Pterostigma and veins yellowish brown. Wings hyaline.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 17.
Palpostilpnus tamasek
sp. nov. , holotype, ♀ (LKCNHM). A . Lateral habitus. B . Head, anterior view. C . Mesopleuron. D . T1, lateral view. E . Scutum.

subSubSection.paragraph: Mostly as in the female but T1 shorter, 1.7 times as long as apically broad, antennal flagellomeres paler ventrally, and most of mesopleuron, most of metasoma and basal part of propodeum dorsally black.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 18.
Palpostilpnus tamasek
sp. nov. , holotype, ♀ (LKCNHM). A . Metasoma, dorsal view. B . Propodeum, dorsal view. C . Ovipositor. D . Wings.

Fig. 19.
Palpostilpnus tamasek
sp. nov. , paratype, ♂ (LKCNHM). A . Lateral habitus. B . Head, anterior view. C . Mesopleuron. D . Propodeum. E . Hypopygium, ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Fore wing 3–3.5 mm long. Antenna with 23–25 flagellomeres. Specimens from Brunei and Indonesia with juxtacoxal carina vestigial, and with more extensive parts of the mesosoma black: 0.6–0.9 of mesopleuron area (anterodorsal portion), central stripe in scutellum and 0.4–0.6 of propodeum (anterior portion plus longitudinal stripe); T2–T5 also mostly black.

This species is similar to
P. trifolium
sp. nov. , but can be distinguished from the latter by having a distinctly more elongated body (1.72 times as long as high, vs 1.48 times as long as high in
P. trifolium
sp. nov. ) and the following combination of characters: gena forming a blunt swelling in its upper part at vertex and eye margin; mesoscutum anteriorly protruding above pronotum; scutellum yellow laterally; vein 2-Cu slightly shorter than 2cu-a; ovipositor longer, 3.5 times as long as hind basitarsus ( Fig. 18C ).
